title: Do you have an exact double somewhere?...
text:
By Stephen Wagner Updated January 30, 2017 . 
A doppleganger is a mysterious, exact double of a living person. It's a German word that literally translates to "double walker" or "double goer". A doppelganger isn't someone who just resembles you, but is an exact double, right down to the way you walk, act, talk and dress. A friend or even a close relative who encounters your doppelganger will swear it was you, even though you can prove you were not in the location the double was sighted. What is a Doppleganger? Sighting and Proof 
Sightings and reports of doppelgangers have been around for centuries, and a great deal of superstition has developed around them. Traditionally, they have been viewed as sinister or even evil entities . Seeing a doppelganger has also been considered an omen of misfortune or bad luck . 
Most often today, however -- as reports of doppelgangers show -- they seem to be neither sinister nor evil, nor do they herald streaks of bad luck. (Although some have been known to cause mischief .) They just seem to be, going about their business as if they are normal human beings. 
continue reading below our video Highest Paid Female Actors Ever And perhaps they are. 
Many reports of doppelgangers are probably cases of mistaken identity, but such an explanation becomes harder to accept when they are seen by best friends, siblings, and parents who know the real person intimately. It seems hard to believe that they would be fooled by another person who simply resembles the original. And how likely is it that they would have the exact same haircut and clothes, as is so often reported? 
Another explanation for the phenomenon -- and no less mysterious -- is bilocation : a psychic projection of yourself - in every detail - that can appear in another place. This phantom self can even interact with other people. Role of the Doppleganger in Fiction 
​Dopplegangers are frequently used as a plot device in literature, television shows and movies. ​They are often evil in nature, but sometimes they are used for comedic effect, too. 
​One of the most famous example's of a doppleganger is in Edgar Allan Poe's short story, William Wilson . In this tale, the main character meets his doppleganger as a child. He is persistently followed by the copy, who causes trouble in the character's life. And when then main character tries to do evil or unethical things, the doppleganger tries to stop him. But in a rage, the protagonist kills his doppleganger, but he realizes it is a reflection of his own self. Dopplegangers in Everyday Life 
​While dopplegangers are usually associated with bad luck and ill omens, coming across your doppleganger does not have to be a terrifying experience. It is certainly strange to find someone who looks, talks and dresses just like you, but speaking with the doppleganger can be a rewarding experience. It can give you unique insight into areas of yourself. 
Dopplegangers are one of the strangest and most interesting paranormal phenomenon. There could be someone our there who looks just like you.
